item.title: Beth add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Beth add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Beth add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Beth add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Beth add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Beth add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Beth add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Beth add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "If you can't be seven feet tall, be seven feet smart." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Beth add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "I thought research would be more glamorous, somehow. I'd give the librarian a secret code word and he'd give me the one book I needed and whisper the necessary page numbers. Like a speakeasy. With books." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Beth add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "There is nothing more terrifying than the absoluteness of one who believes he's right." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Beth add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Beth add a quote by Michael Chabon
item.description: "Drunk, Jane spoke as though she were Nancy Drew. I was a fool for a girl with a dainty lexicon." -- Michael Chabon

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Locke
item.description: "Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours." -- John Locke

item.title: Beth add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Beth add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"In the beginning, God created the earth, and he looked upon it in his cosmic loneliness.
And God said, "Let Us make living creatures out of mud, so the mud can see what We have done." And God created every living creature that now moveth, and one was man. Mud as man alone could speak. God leaned close to mud as man sat, looked around, and spoke. "What is the purpose of all this?" he asked politely.
"Everything must have a purpose?" asked God.
"Certainly," said man.
"Then I leave it to you to think of one for all this," said God.
And He went away." -- Kurt Vonnegut
